I used to cut and still dealing with suicidal thoughts, so I just don't want to take any chances watching that show. I don't think it is their fault if it would negatively affect me, but I do think if you're dealing with these types of issues or have in the past that it is important to be careful about it. Like I remember watching that one scene in Ex Machina and suddenly getting the urge to slit my wrist... so watching a entire show about these things might not be good for my mental health, although that is a flaw on my part, not something I can blame on the creators of the show.
I do hope that if anything the show encourages people to talk about depression and self-harm and suicidal thoughts in a mature and open way.
I mean after a certain point they can't really control it anymore, like did you parents tell you what you could and couldn't watch at 16 for an instance?

I know they are people, and I don't want to hurt them or anything like that, but yeah fuck them. I am not going to be friendly to people with power over me, that is submission, fuck that shit. There can never be an even or fair relationship between cops and civilians, so I will absoutely not act as if I have any kind of respect for cops.
